title: Fix navigation bug in mobile view
body:
## Description
The navigation menu doesn't work properly on mobile devices. When users tap on menu items, they don't navigate to the correct pages.

## Steps to Reproduce
1. Open the application on a mobile device
2. Tap on the hamburger menu
3. Try to navigate to different pages

## Expected Behavior
Menu items should navigate to the correct pages when tapped.

## Actual Behavior
Menu items are unresponsive or navigate to wrong pages.

## Environment
- Device: iPhone 12
- Browser: Safari
- OS: iOS 15.6

title: Add dark mode support
body:
## Feature Request
It would be great to have a dark mode option for better user experience, especially for users who prefer dark themes or use the application in low-light environments.

## Proposed Solution
- Add a theme toggle in the settings
- Implement dark variants for all UI components
- Save user preference in localStorage
- Respect system theme preference

## Benefits
- Improved user experience
- Better accessibility
- Reduced eye strain in low-light conditions
- Modern application standard

title: Update API documentation
body:
## Documentation Update
The API documentation needs to be updated to reflect the new endpoints and changes introduced in v1.1.0.

## What needs to be updated:
- [ ] Add documentation for `/api/analytics` endpoint
- [ ] Update `/api/issues` endpoint parameters
- [ ] Add examples for new response formats
- [ ] Update authentication section
- [ ] Add rate limiting information

## Additional improvements:
- Add interactive API explorer
- Include code examples in multiple languages
- Add troubleshooting section

title: Performance optimization for large datasets
body:
## Performance Issue
The application becomes slow when dealing with repositories that have a large number of issues (>1000).

## Current Problems
- Initial load takes more than 10 seconds
- Scrolling through issues is laggy
- Search functionality is slow
- Memory usage increases significantly

## Proposed Solutions
1. **Implement virtual scrolling** for issue lists
2. **Add pagination** instead of loading all issues at once
3. **Optimize database queries** with proper indexing
4. **Add caching layer** for frequently accessed data
5. **Implement progressive loading** for issue details

## Success Criteria
- Initial load time < 3 seconds
- Smooth scrolling with 60fps
- Search results in < 1 second
- Memory usage stays below 100MB

title: Question: How to configure custom classifications?
body:
## Question
I'm trying to set up custom issue classifications for my team, but I'm not sure how to configure the classification rules.

## What I've tried
- Looked at the documentation (couldn't find specific instructions)
- Checked the configuration files
- Searched through existing issues

## What I need
- Steps to create custom classification rules
- Examples of classification configurations
- Information about available classification criteria

## Use case
We have specific types of issues in our workflow:
- Customer reports
- Internal bugs
- Feature requests from sales
- Technical debt

I'd like to automatically classify these based on issue title, labels, and content.
